text: I‚Äôm excited to announce that today I‚Äôm joining @Microsoft as CEO of Microsoft AI. I‚Äôll be leading all consumer AI products and research, including Copilot, Bing and Edge. My friend and longtime collaborator Kar√©n Simonyan will be Chief Scientist, and several of our amazing‚Ä¶

‚ÄòBrowsing‚Äô is about to be completely transformed. Finally, our AIs have learnt to speak our languages, and actually see what we see.  This demo is particularly close to my heart. It completes work that I started at DeepMind back in 2011.
Just think, 15 years ago, AI could hardly recognize a single object in a 256x256 image.

Our first product was a fashion search engine that allowed you to browse similar colors, patterns and styles. It was too early for deep learning back then.  But now to see it come to fruition is just surreal.  It‚Äôs like having a partner to think out loud with, infinitely patient,‚Ä¶
We‚Äôre reimagining what @MSFTCopilot, your everyday AI companion, can do in @Windows. It will be an app like experience that is simpler and more personal, showing up when and where you need it.

Standby for more details on the full spectrum of capabilities we are demoing today; they‚Äôre coming to every Copilot very soon.  This is an incredibly exciting time. I want to pay tribute to the teams at @Microsoft and @OpenAI who are making this possible.  And especially to‚Ä¶

Microsoft changed computing history by inventing a new category: the Personal Computer or PC.  Now we‚Äôre re-inventing PCs for the AI era, taking us from personal computing to truly personal intelligence.  Today we‚Äôre launching a new product category: Copilot+ PCs, the biggest‚Ä¶

Real personality. Effortless interactions. The ability to see what we see.¬† ‚ú®  I‚Äôve long argued that AIs with EQ, IQ and AQ are coming. Here‚Äôs the first real glimpse of what‚Äôs its gonna feel like.  It‚Äôs a magical experience: smart, intuitive, natural, and useful.

We are taking Copilot to the next level. üöÄ  Copilot will see, hear, speak and help in real time.  Watch this demo to see what I mean. Soon your AI companion will start to live life alongside you, whether playing Minecraft or helping you navigate life‚Äôs most difficult challenges.‚Ä¶

Biomimicry can never be underrated as an inspiration for technology (including AI). Almost always nature has found an answer first e.g. a snail robot to scoop up microplastics. https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/12/snail-inspired-robot-could-scoop-ocean-microplastics
Well worth a listen, super interesting as you would expect. Some of the best minds (and all round people) in AI and tech.

5/5 At Microsoft AI we are up for this. We are building products and shaping a future of massive positive impact. It's still only the beginning of a long journey ahead, but we have a vision for Copilot that is ambitious and, we believe, truly transformational. I couldn't be more‚Ä¶

4/5 Responsible AI is a cornerstone. Everyone is working hard to define new norms and everyone I've met feels a deep responsibility to do so with an open heart and a humble mind... Massive kudos to all the teams working on this!

3/5 AI is everything here. @satyanadella and @kevin_scott¬†been so clear about this. Microsoft is a truly AI-first business driving the biggest technological transformation of our time. I knew this already of course... But seeing this in practice, at this scale, is impressive.

2/5 The company is defined by a genuinely supportive and strong culture from top to bottom. It's rare to see this at any scale of business. But it's made joining and getting used to everything super easy. Thank you to everyone for being so welcoming (and patient) as we've been‚Ä¶

1/5 I've been at Microsoft for just over a month. It's been an exhilarating journey getting to know a huge number of people, organizations and projects, without doubt one of the most exciting and fulfilling times I‚Äôve ever experienced.  Here's a few things I've learned:
